intro: Spiraea bella, commonly known as the beauty bush, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that appear in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and has arching branches covered in fine, dark green foliage. Its flowers, which range from white to pink, are borne in cylindrical racemes and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Spiraea bella prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
